Day1: ^You wake up, still tired from not having slept well.
^“Maybe the police can do without their switchboard officer today,” you think briefly.
^Slowly, you get out of bed and prepare to set off for work.
^The long trudge to the police station was made better by the shade cast by a rare cloudy day. Antiford does not get many overcast days.
^The office is almost stiflingly hot. You set your bag down. Your assistant, Francis, is sitting at his desk, filing through some papers.

greet_francis: ^“I am well, Sergeant. You're a little late. Did you have a difficult morning?
^“Not too difficult. And, so I am... hrm. My watch has been running behind lately."
^“I've brought you a chilled tea from the shop around the corner.”
^“Thank you, Francis. That is my favorite shop.”
after_greet: ^"Here is a note for you from Lt. Hughes. It's regarding an incident this morning. I think he wants you to moniter the situation."
note: ^A tea house on Mallory Lane was robbed at gunpoint. Confirm the facts with Sergeant Doherty and Officer Wiley, who are on the scene.
briggs: ^"What are you contacting me for? I am no where near the tea house. I think that was assigned to Sgt. Doherty."
doherty: ^"The witnesses report seeing a short, thin individual wearing all black with a hood. None of them saw the suspect's face."
wiley: ^"I have taken a statement from the owner. She reports the suspect is slim man with brown hair. She did not see his face due to a leather mask he was wearing."
custer: ^"I am not at the tea house. I think Officer Wiley is there."
afterall: ^That seems to be all the facts, then.
^"It's not for anyone. There's no name. It just says:
^"Well Francis, that *is* rather odd. But it's been a long day. I'll be heading home now. Have a good night."

Day2: ^The next morning you find your desk just as you had left it the day before.
^And before you say anything, I know I'm late again. I really must do something about my watch. Perhaps I should drop it off to be serviced."
^"There is another note for you from the lieutenant. He wants you to follow up with the team investigating this crime."

normalnote: ^A flower shop on High Top Road was broken into early this morning. Sergeant Briggs and Officer Wiley are investigating.
firenote: ^A flower shop on High Top Road was broken into early this morning. Sergeant Briggs and Officer Wiley are investigating.
briggs: ^"The proprietor says that a brick was used to break in the front window. Not sure if anything was taken. There is considerable damage."
doherty: ^"What are you contacting me for? I am no where near the flower shop. I think that was assigned to Sgt. Briggs."
wiley: ^"I'm allergic to flowers, so they let me off the case. I think Officer Custer is there."
normalcuster: ^"A witness states that they saw a thin man with short brown hair running away from the scene. He had a bundle of flowers in his hands."
firecuster: ^"A young boy said that he saw a figure, dressed well, throw a bottle through the window to the tea house.
^Shortly afterward, fire started to spread through the house."
afterall: ^That seems to be all the facts, then.
^"Well, Francis. Another long day. Are there any other telegraphs?"
^"It appears that there is one more..."
^"There is no name. It just says
^"Again with the odd one? I wonder who is sending them. It seems a waste to send only that.
^Oh, well. I suppose I will head on home now."
givenflowers: ^After a long walk, you arrive at home to find a bundle of flowers on the mat in front of your door.

Day3: ^You arrive at the station just as Francis is setting his things down.
^"I see that you are on time, did you get your watch fixed?"
^"No, but I did drop it off at the jeweler on my way in. I made sure that I woke extra early so that wouldn't be late."
^"Very good. Maybe this will help you be on time more regularly."
^"I hope so. Unfortunately, in my haste this morning, I forgot to pack a lunch."
^"It should be fine. The 'Black Leaf and Earl' isn't far. I'll probably walk over and grab a sandwich."
^Francis leaves and busies himself around the station.
^Several hours pass, lunch break is fast approaching.
^Francis walks up to you with a note in his hand.
^"There's another note from Lt. Hughes. It looks like another robbery.

note: ^At 10 this morning, the Black Leaf and Earl was robbed. The suspect made off with a considerable amount of money. Sergeant Doherty and Officer Wiley are on the scene.
briggs: ^"What are you contacting me for? I am no where near the Black Leaf and Earl. I think that was assigned to Sgt. Doherty."
doherty: ^"The owner states that a slim man with brown hair and a leather mask robbed the restaurant at gun point.
^The restaurant will be closed until the interviews are concluded and the assessor has arrived."
wiley: ^"The patrons all stated that the suspect is a shorter, thin man.
^One man stated that it seemed as though he was just trying to scare people and was not actually interested in the money.
^Another said that he stole her sandwich."
custer: ^"I am not at the Black Leaf and Earl. I think Officer Wiley is there."
afterall: ^That seems to be all the facts, then.
^"A similar description for three crimes on three consectutive days.
^I wonder if they could be the same person."
^"That would seem to make sense. But what ever could the motive be?"
^Though it's disappointing that I wont be able to go to the Black Leaf and Earl for lunch."
^"Here, Sergeant. Have half of my sandwich."
^"I insist. I'm not overly hungry today."
^The rest of the day passes very slowly.
^Just before you stand to leave, you hear the telegraph ticker printing out another message.
^Once again, you are looking at a message addressed to no one.
^You feel a little uneasy on your walk home and through the night.

Day4: ^You arrive at the station extra late.
^Officer Custer knocks you to the street bumbling his way out of the station.
^"Sorry!" he says as he fades into the distance.
^You stand up and brush yourself off. You can see Francis looking out the window gasping.
^By the time you get inside, Francis is already quite busy.
^"Yes, They seem to be taking a while. I'm not really sure how long these things are supposed to take."
^"Well, I'm sure they make good time."
^Francis rummages through a stack of papers and hands one to you.

note: ^A jewelry store is robbed. Sergeant Briggs and Officer Custer are on the scene.
briggs: ^Been talking to witnesses. No perp sightings, but we've found an out-of-place handkerchief on the window sill, deep blue.
doherty: ^“I'm not on that case, Sergeant. I'm doing patrols.”
wiley: ^“No, no. Sergeant *Doherty* and Officer Custer are down at the jewelers', not I.”
custer: ^I just spoke with the proprietor. They're still cleaning up, not sure if anything was stolen. Many of the glass cases were broken, so it's likely.
afterall: ^That seems to be all the facts, then.
^"Hey, Sergeant, they wanted me to give you this. They found this at the scene."
^"Looks to be in working order, sir."
^"But wait, wouldn't procedure dictate this be in the evidence—"
^Francis sneezes and pats his pockets, looking for a hankercheif.
^"This is heavy, concerning stuff. These crimes are cutting very close to home."
^You look at the message, no address or name, just:
^You watch your back on the way home.
^You could swear you saw a waifish shadow follow you.
^What does one do? When you are the police and you feel unsafe?

Day5: ^You woke up at a reasonable time, watch ticking nicely, but you found it hard to pull yourself out of bed after the stress this week's work has put you under.

b: ^ At least you could look forward to your conversations with your assistant.

Day5: ^Francis was the most overly-helpful employee at the station you'd ever seen.

b: ^ It was often a bit overkill. Nice kid, but misguided.

Day5: ^When you made it to the office, the building was unusually dead. The lieutenant wasn't there,
^Not even Francis was in at work today.
^"Where is everyone?" you say to yourself.
^A note was left on your desk...

note: ^Officer Custer was shot, taken to the hospital. I am personally looking after him. Check in with everybody.

b: ^ I know you already heard some of this, but

briggs: ^I'm here with Sergeant Doherty, and it's pretty crazy to think that one of our own did this.
^ locked up in the back of the paddy wagon.

b: ^ I know you already heard some of this, but

doherty: ^I'm here with Sergeant Briggs trying to process this.

b: ^ Your assistant... Francis... he attacked Officer Custer.

doherty: ^If it were up to me, we'd send
^ to pleasantville, let him rot in the desert.

b: ^ So, Doherty and Briggs have the real details, but... well Francis is in big trouble.

wiley: ^Witnesses say that the young lad jumped Officer Custer as he was leaving his home this morning.
^The boy woke up pretty darn early for this.
^This was not his first rodeo; I suspect he had something to do with some of our recent unsolved crimes.
hughes: ^Just looking after Officer Custer. He's been cut up and blugeoned. Very graphic.
^I'm going to have the... culprit — dry world — taken to the station for some serious interrogation.
afterall: ^You wonder why Francis did all this.

b: ^ "You were the sunshine of my day!"

afterall: ^Doherty, Wiley, and Briggs burst in and tackle Francis to the ground.
^Lieutenant Gerald Hughes walks in holding his gun.
^"You're going away for a very long time, kid."
^You take the rest of the day off, not sure how to feel about all this.
^As you walk home, you find a piece of paper in your pocket. It read:
